comment: Musty nose, light flavor once you get past the alcohol.
It's a clean, easy drinking whisky...but really very much unidimensional.  Not much going on in there, no complexity or layers of flavors.  Try the French oak, by far much better.
Fruity... Vanilla flavoring somewhere in there.
Notably smooth. Sweet nose, bit of butterscotch? Bottle states youngest barrel 14 y 10 m old! Includes 7 barrels. Delightful dram.

Nose- vanilla, sweet, can smell the bourbon and port influences. 
Tasting- smooth, surprisingly long warm finish, slight spiced vanilla, bourbon caramels, rum n raisin chocolate, easy drinking great dram would definitely buy this bottle!

What a wonderful whisky! It really hits all the points I like with no peat. Unbelievably long finish but so bright on the nose with floral scents and spices. So this really just malted barley or did they sneak in some rye and corn for spice and sweetness?
Could drink this scotch all day long. Malty and lingering.
A little underwhelming to be honest. After hearing about it for years I expected more. Almond, vanilla... not much else. Very smooth ;)
Had this at the distillery (21/4/18) and was described as a breakfast whisky. The nose has vanilla and honey and translates into the palate as well but no sign of cereals

Bought this at the distillery after the tour & tasting. At $50 including tastings, if you're in Tassie this is a must do!. It was described to me as their "Breakfast Whisky". Lighter than its big brother the French Oak but flavour is still there. It's also a lot cheaper!
Good whisky. Loses structure quickly with water and air.
Brilliant stuff from the land down under. Silky smooth with notes of caramel, honey, berries, chocolate and vanilla.
Pour 1/7 drammers club. Batch DC097. Very good with notes of vanilla, honey, caramel, grapes, sweet malt, pepper, floral, banana, coconut. 45% abv
An absolutely amazing drink - smooth and balanced in sweetness and beautiful on the nose. Could drink this endlessly

Nose: Brioche, floral, vanilla slice
Front: citrus zest
Mouth: oily
This has a sweetness to it that makes me wonder if it's had something added post- distillation
